resources.string: The temple was built in Taipei in 1738 by settlers from Fujian during Qing rule in honor of Guanyin.

The Red House Theater is a historic theater in Ximending.

The museum building was originally built in 1913 during the Japanese rule of Taiwan. It was initially built as Beitou Public Bathhouse, the largest bathhouse in East Asia at that time.
No.2, Zhongshan Rd., Beitou Dist., Taipei City 11243
It is a memorial to the Republic of China National Father, Dr. Sun Yat-sen, and was completed in 1972.
No.505, Sec. 4, Ren’ai Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City 11073
Yangmingshan National Park is one of the nine national parks in Taiwan. Different from the high mountain national parks, Yangmingshan National Park has a lower elevation.
No.1-20, Zhuzihu Rd., Beitou Dist., Taipei City 11292
A restaurant originating in Taiwan, specialising in xiaolongbao (steamed dumplings).
No.194, Sec. 2, Da’an Rd., Da’an Dist., Taipei City 10667
Beef noodle soup is a Chinese and Taiwanese noodle soup made of stewed or red braised beef, beef broth, vegetables and Chinese noodles.
No.274, Sec. 2, Bade Rd., Zhongshan Dist., Taipei City 10492
The night market encompasses two distinct sections sharing a symbiotic relationship: a section formerly housed in the old Shilin Market building, containing mostly food vendors and small restaurants.
No.101, Jihe Rd., Shilin Dist., Taipei City 11162
Oyster vermicelli or oamisoir is a kind of noodle soup popular in Taiwan. Its main ingredients are oysters and misua (Chinese vermicelli).
No.8-1, Emei St., Wanhua Dist., Taipei City 10844
a unique bathroom-themed restaurant chain, based in Taiwan, with several branches throughout Asia.
No.7, Ln. 50, Xining S. Rd., Wanhua Dist., Taipei City 10841

Is a landmark supertall skyscraper in Xinyi District, Taipei, Republic of China. The building was officially classified as the world tallest in 2004, and remained such until the completion of the Burj Khalifa in Dubai in 2009.
No.7, Sec. 5, Xinyi Rd., Xinyi Dist., Taipei City 11049
A shopping center in Songshan District, Taipei, Taiwan.
No.39, Sec. 1, Fuxing S. Rd., Songshan Dist., Taipei City 10556
Ximending is a neighborhood and shopping district in the Wanhua District of Taipei, Taiwan. It was the first pedestrian zone in Taiwan.
No.1, Chengdu Rd., Wanhua Dist., Taipei City 108
Dihua Street is a street located in the Dadaocheng area of Datong District, Taipei, Taiwan. winding from the south of the district to close to the north in the old village of Dalongdong.
Sec. 1, Dihua St., Datong Dist., Taipei City 103
Pacific Sogo started its business in 1986 as a joint venture between Taiwan Pacific Construction and Japan Sogo, and in 1987 opened its first department store in Taipei.
No.45, Sec. 4, Zhongxiao E. Rd., Da’an Dist., Taipei City 10691

Taipei City is the capital city and a special municipality of Taiwan. Sitting at the northern tip of the island, Taipei City is an enclave of the municipality of New Taipei City. Taipei is the political, economic, educational, and cultural center of Taiwan, and one of the major hubs of the Chinese-speaking world. Considered to be a global city.
Taipei Metro, Taipei Mass Rapid Transit or MRT, or the Taipei Rapid Transit System , is a rapid transit system serving metropolitan Taipei, Taiwan
